author: hwright
msg: Make svn client to use the 'LFS' capability of 'neon' to allow commits
of new file(post-compression) beyond > 2GB in size.
Note that Neon currently doesn't support > 2GB on Windows, so this only
fixes this issue on Linux, *BSD and probably MacOS.
A simple cast limits our maximum upload file size on systems where neon

author: hwright
msg: Fix depth_tests.py 23 issues that sometimes occurs on Windows when a BDB
repository is not unlocked fast enough to delete it in the testcycle.
(Reported multiple times by Mark Phippard, Jens Peters and me as failure
Tests that often fail for the wrong reason, might hide real issues
